snippet: A growing number of baby boomers are venturing into old age on their own, a shift that is changing the traditional portrait of older Americans.
abstract: Divorce rate among baby boomers has surged by more than 50 percent, even as divorce rates over all have stabilized nationally, indicating that more people in their 50s and 60s are choosing to venture into old age on their own; trend is likely to change the traditional portrait of old age in America, and transform the way the elderly are cared for, shifting much of the economic burden to federal and local governments.
lead_paragraph: A growing number of baby boomers are venturing into old age on their own, a shift that is changing the traditional portrait of older Americans.

headline.seo: More Americans Rejecting Marriage in 50s and Beyond
headline.main: More Americans Rejecting Marriage in 50s and Beyond
headline.print_headline: More Americans Rejecting Marriage In 50s and Beyond
